*Steps to reproduce*
More easily explained using [this video|http://screencast.com/t/lkZF54NlN9H]. As can be seen, the defect is specific to using autofromatting. Inserting the emoticon via editor toolbar does not result in an error.
In addition, the error does not occur if the point previous to the insertion is not indented.

Link to the other issue regarding cursor going back to previous points

(/) 4.1

(/) IE8
(x) IE9
(x) FF8

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23925].
  {panel}

When Editing UD of type 'Internal with LDAP Authentication' it does not expose the "Enable Nested' field.
Please enable Support of Nested Groups for this type of UD.

We are forced to use this type of UD since we are a large institution and embedded crowd is 'greedy'. Our ADS Directory is extremely huge and even though we only use several hundred existing ADS groups for privileges in Confluence they are from across the spectrum of OU's, therefore UD Group LDAP filter configuration cannot limit embedded crowd from attempting to copy/sync a huge portion of the entire AD directory (even though most AD users and groups have nothing to do with Confluence software anyway).

Thanks,
Craig
fields.summary: Support of Nested Groups for Internal Directory with LDAP Auth.

fields.description:
In user settings, German is configured as default language. If I edit a page, and want to add a link, I press "Insert Link" or Ctrl+K. The "Insert Link" popup dialog appears. The characters of the hint below are half-cropped and can not be read. 

Works fine with user language English.

Workaround: Select, copy and paste to other editing tool to read the hint.
fields.summary: characters of hint at insert link popup dialog are half-cropped with user settings language German

fields.description:
h4. Summary of The Bug

When "Confluence Drag & Drop" plugin is turn on, whenever user try to paste and image into Confluence editor, Confluence would

# Attach the image into the instance
# Display the image to the editor

When the plugin is disable, Confluence still display the image leading customer to believe that it is still working fine, however since the image is not actually saved successfully into the instance, it would show broken image upon saving.

This issue only appear on FireFox 8 and 9 release

h4. How to reproduce the issue

# Disable "Confluence Drag & Drop"
# Print Screen your machine screen
# Paste it into the editor of Confluence 4.0 (Right click then paste)
# Image would be displayed
# Save
# Confluence would not be able to show the image and it replace with {{"Broken Image"}} message
fields.summary: Pasting image when "Drag and Drop" is disabled give a misleading error

fields.description: When copying tables it seems it does not preserve highlighted rows.
fields.summary: Copying Tables - Does not maintain Highlighted rows.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23917].
  {panel}

Requested feature:
Allow to switch the wiki full text search into a "layman mode", where it finds anything containing the entered text as or WITHIN a word, equivalent to a search for "*asdf*" in Windows explorer.

Background:
I have observed that new Confluence users often enter parts of words in the search field and then complain because the wiki doesn't find the pages having words *containing* this part.

A typical example is the german word "Kanalhaltung" (engl. sewer pipeline). People often just look for "Haltung" or "Kanal" or "Kanalhalt" and simply expect pages containing "Kanalhaltung" to be found. Especially the typical German compound words are susceptible to this problem.

The average user doesn't know about wildcards and doesn't want to use them.

I am aware that such a search would be significantly slower, but for our users getting *all* results is far more important than getting *quick* results.

(This issue is crucial for user acceptance by our customer for which we intend to install it as a documentation system.)

Matthias Basler
fields.summary: Have more intuitive full text search ("layman mode")

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23913].
  {panel}

Steps:
1) Edit a wiki page with a link
2) Click on the link
3) In the Edit Link dialog, try to edit the link text
Result: the link text is not editable here

It can be hard to edit the link text in the editor. Where does the link begin and end? This is why Word and other editors let you edit link text in the dialogs, not just in the editor.

Confluence should enable editing of the link text in the dialog.
fields.summary: Enable editing link text in "Edit Link" dialog

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23912].
  {panel}

A documentation site usually offers different versions of the documentation to support different versions of the product. This is because customers upgrade to the latest release at different times.

Technical writers often organise the different versions of the product documentation in different spaces.

When a person comes to the documentation wiki, it would be nice to ask them which product and which version they need. One implementation could be a dropdown list at the top of every page (in the page header) which allows the user to select the product and version that they are interested in.

This would be useful as part of the Confluence Documentation theme. For example, the theme could offer another configuration option: Request product/version information Yes/No. It could also allow the administrator to specify the space(s) applicable to each product/version, which would populate the dropdown list offered to the user.

This idea can apply to more than just versions of the product. For example, the space administrator could use the option to offer specific documentation for different configurations of the product or different platforms.
fields.summary: Prompt user for product and version in Documentation theme

fields.description: We have found that Activity Streams can be very slow for activity requests that filter specifically for nearly any activity other than "Page added", "Page edited", or "Commented added".  With our internal Confluence instances, page updates and comments are much more common than other kinds of activity.  The current implementation does not take content type into account when searching for relevant activity items.
fields.summary: Activity Streams may be slow when filtering specifically for "blog added" or "space added"
"What's New" modal display HTML source code on computers running Snow Leopard and Safari v5.1.1

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23907].
  {panel}

We are using Confluence and would like to send email-notifications as plaintext with the changed content.
Today this is sent with HTML (and not possible with plaintext), where the changed content is highlighted in green. As this is done with CSS in the HTML, emailreaders will not be able to translate this into plaintext, forcing our users to view the emails as HTML.

Our request is to get an email like this: 

User [username] changed the page [page name]
Comment: [comment]
--------------------------------------
\- Roses are blue violets are green
+ Roses are red violets are blue
And so are you
Loreum ipsum lori di sa dor
\- Ipsum la mi da sorium 
+ Hipla dopla dei
[...]
--------------------------------------

Very much like the 'git diff' og 'svn diff'. Is this possible?
fields.summary: Changed content email in plaintext

fields.description:
The entries in a tasklist are not displayed if a table of contents macro is used.

I was able to reproduce this at the Atlassian Confluence sandbox: http://sandbox.onconfluence.com/display/2/Tasklist-Contents+Test

To reproduce:

* Create a new page
* Create a tasklist
* Save
* Add a task: "My Task"
* Edit
* Create a TOC at the top
* Save
* View the page: "My Task" is gone

If you edit the page again you can still see the task data, it just doesn't show up when you view the page.

I first noticed this with my standalone installation of Confluence 4.0, but it seems to affect 4.0.4 in the Sandbox.
fields.summary: Table of contents makes tasklist blank

fields.description:
h3. Summary of Bug

When using Confluence 4.0.4 in Internet Explorer 8, in the editor, if the user right clicks on either the 'Status' or 'Contributor' macro and clicks 'cut', the macro can be cut successfully, but is unable to be pasted anywhere.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a page in Confluence 4.0.4 using Internet Explorer 8
# Insert either the 'Status' or 'Contributor' macro
# Right click on the macro and select 'cut'
# Try to 'paste' the macro anywhere in the editor

h3. Findings

This only seems to affect Internet Explorer 8. Have tested this in Firefox and it works fine. Version of Internet Explorer used to test is 8.0.7600.16385.
fields.summary: 'Status' and 'Contributors' macro is unable to be cut & paste in IE8

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23899]. {panel} h3. User story A user inserts a numbered bullet list, types in one item, then presses ENTER. The RTE at this point produces: {code} 1. first point 2. CURSOR HERE {code} What they want is to continue adding text and content after the first bullet. They aren't ready for the second yet. In wiki markup they would just: {code} # first point keep typing more stuff here which would be part of the first point {code} The solution of course is SHIFT + ENTER. However, a majority of users aren't aware of this. [One example|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/20874/numbered-lists-break-when-you-remove-the-numbering-function-from-lines-in-the-sequence-that-do-not-need-to-use-numbers]. We could adopt the stance that we need to train / educate users. But I think there's a still better way, and MS Word has implemented it, and I think its brilliant. h3. Suggestion When the RTE shows: {code} 1. first 2. CURSOR IS BLINKING HERE - second 3. third {code} If the user hits backspace, they get: {code} 1. first CURSOR IS BLINKING HERE - second 2. third {code} Note: # numbering has been restored (so (3) becomes (2)) # the contents of second bullet has been moved to the first. # the user doesn't have to know about SHIFT + ENTER. Backspace is what I've seen a few people doing intuitively to remove the bullet style. Lets give them that instead. Technically the DOM should be: {code}
  1. first
    second
  2. third
{code}
fields.summary: Backspacing a bullet item should remove the bullet style only

fields.description:
Control characters in the wikimarkup before a 4.0.x migration can cause the WikiXhtmlConverter to error (silently) and cause blank data to be committed to the database in its stead.

If the problematic string is inserted into the "insert wiki markup" macro, the api generates a 500 internal server error, but the XhtmlException is swallowed.

When inspected, this is the error:
{code}
Illegal character ((CTRL-CHAR, code 7))
at [row,col {unknown-source}]: [1,609]
The XML content could not be parsed. There is a problem at line 1, column 609. Parser message: Illegal character ((CTRL-CHAR, code 7))
at [row,col {unknown-source}]: [1,609]

{code}
fields.summary: Control Characters in wiki markup cause 500 error and possibly lost data.

fields.description:
h3. Summary of Bug

When using IE9, if a user copies and pastes multiple lines into the editor of Confluence 4.0.3, the line breaks will not work properly.

*This issue also happens on IE (Internet Explorer) 10, IE11.*


h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Using IE9, start up Confluence 4.0.3 and create a page
# Paste the following :
{code}
hello this is foogie woogie
<!DOCTYPE html> <html> <head> <title>Angry Nerds Documentation Home - Angry Nerds Documentation - Confluence Sandbox</title> <meta http-equiv="X-UA-Compatible" content="IE=EDGE"> <meta charset="UTF-8"> <!-- Deprecated since 3.4. To be removed in a future version of Confluence; use AJS.Confluence.getContextPath() --> <meta id="confluence-context-path" name="confluence-context-path" content=""> <meta id="confluence-base-url" name="confluence-base-url" content="http://sandbox.onconfluence.com"> <meta id="atlassian-token" name="atlassian-token" content="192782e79f2cc710c0ff54fb9d73b21b6eb4cb5b">
i am here for a story
{code}
into the editor
# The line breaks will not work properly.

h3. Findings

This seems to only affect IE. When using IE9, this is the result of pasting those lines into the editor :
!line break IE.png|thumbnail!

I tested this using Firefox 8, and this was the result :
!line break FF8.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Line breaks in IE9 is broken
Can't create page based on template through link

fields.description:
h3. Summary of Bug

When using the Info Box macro in Confluence 4.0.3, if the user copies and pastes the end portion of a line, and then presses backspace, the entire line is erased.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a new page in Confluence 4.0.3
# Insert the 'Info Box' macro
# Within the 'Info Box' macro, enter a line, for example, 'Today is a good day'
# Copy the last word, that is, 'day', and paste it after the word (so now it looks something like this : 'Today is a good dayday'.)
# Press 'backspace'. The entire line will be deleted

h3. Findings

* It does not matter how far the original line is from the copied word. For example, you can put in 5 spaces between 'Today is a good day' and then paste 'day', when you press backspace, the entire line will still be deleted

* After the entire line is deleted, even pressing 'Ctrl+Z' won't restore it to the most recent value. It will only restore the original value. 
For example, my original line is 'Today is a good day', and I paste it in such a way that it becomes 'Today is a good day day'. After pressing backspace, then pressing 'Ctrl+Z' to undo, it will only show 'Today is a good day' instead of 'Today is a good day day'.
fields.summary: After copy and pasting, pressing backspace deletes everything in Info Box
Confluence-Admin should be able to create a page template from an imported document

fields.description:
h3. Summary of Bug

In Confluence 4.0 and above, if there are two slashes, or '//', in the code macro, then any code after the '//' will be rendered as comments and might not be rendered correctly.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# In a page in Confluence 4.0 and above, enter a block of code (Either through entering Wiki Markup, or through the Code Block macro)
# In one of the lines of the code, enter '//'
# Preview or save the page

h3. Findings

The example code is :
{code}
This is the first example:link="http://Testing1"> another link="http://Testing2">
 
This is the second example:link="http://mine.com" another link="http://yours.com">
 
This is an example:link="http://google.com" another link= "http://yahoo.com">
{code}

In Confluence 4.0 and above, anything after '//' is rendered as code and part of the code seems to be missing. In Confluence 4.0, this is the result :
!code macro 1.png|thumbnail!

While in Confluence 3.5.11, this is the obtained result :
!code macro 2.png|thumbnail!

Additional testing has shown that the rendering issue only shows itself when the following is present :

* A 'http://' is entered after a '//' 
* The line of code is ended with a '>'
fields.summary: Code Block displayed incorrectly if '//' is present

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23873].
  {panel}

We have pages that contain attachments that are updated regularly (i.e. once a day).
We do not require a full history for those attachments.

It should be possible to limit the number of attachment revisions for certain spaces/pages/attachments.
Once the limit has been reached, the oldest revision should be removed automatically.
fields.summary: Allow to set maximum number of Attachment Versions

  1. one

fields.summary: Firefox places nest list item content in the wrong spot on delete

fields.description:
I can't edit latest version of UI mockup created for a Confluence page.  Please see the attached screenshots.

To replicate the problem:
1.  Create a new page in Confluence or go to an existing page.
2.  Click on the +Add icon at the top left and select Add UI Mockup.
3.  Make changes to the UI Mockup and go to Mockup -> Save and Close.
4.  On your page, a thumbnail of the UI mockup should appear with an "edit this mockup" link below it.  Click the link.
5.  Make additional changes to the UI Mockup and go to Mockup -> Save and Close.
6.  A second image with an "edit this mockup" link below it will appear, but instead of a thumbnail, it will be a red X, as if the thumbnail were unavailable.  The link will be the same as the first link: They will both go to v1 of your mockup, and you will not be able to access the latest version of your mockup.

When you look at the Wiki Markup view, you'll see that there are actually two versions, but ... how do you get to v2?

Thanks,
Charlie
fields.summary: Can't edit latest version of UI mockup created for a Confluence page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23861].
  {panel}

Too often in support cases we feel like Vogons explaining to Earth why their planet is about to be destroyed:

{quote}
There's no point in acting all surprised about it. All the planning charts and demolition orders have been on display in your local planning department in Alpha Centauri for fifty of your Earth years, so you've had plenty of time to lodge any formal complaint and it's far too late to start making a fuss now.
...
What do you mean you've never been to Alpha Centauri? For heaven's sake mankind, it's only four light years away you know. I'm sorry, but if you can't be bothered to take interest in local affairs that's your own lookout.
{quote}

For whatever reason, our documentation is skipped which leads to disappointment, confusion and sometimes anger, especially considering there's no easy roll back process.

I propose two things:

# Work to improve and simplify our documentation so it's easily read and understood
# Request acknowledgement of the release notes/documentation prior to starting an upgrade task

While we obviously can't avoid the problem entirely, this should at least minimise the amount of confused customers who upgrade to a new version and discover that their favourite feature has been removed or altered. Obviously the onus is then on us to ensure that the documentation is easier to read and follow so that it's not simply skipped over.
fields.summary: Acknowledgement of documentation prior to upgrading
Fast Copy/Paste/Edit Macros
More obvious way to delete text block Macros
Insert single JIRA Issue via Autocomplete
Simple (non-pop-up-form) way to create a wiki link
I like can custom PDF Stylesheet when using it through Tools > Export to PDF.

fields.description:
When non-ascii characters are contained in the metadata macro field name and/or values, the Detailssummary macro garbles up the output, even fills blank values with garbage characters. 

To reproduce, create a test page containing a metadata macro with a field name/value table using German characters such as öÖüÜäÄß in either Field Names, Values or both. Create a label on that page to make it reportable with the detailssummary table. 
Save the Metadata page and observe that the characters render properly.

Now create a second page with a Detailssummary macro referring the previously created label. Observe how the characters get garbled up.
fields.summary: Detailssummary Macro produces garbled characters when using non-Ascii Characters in Metadata Macro
Allow a URL to be used when specifying the logo for a space

fields.description:
Created a Gliffy diagram. In the editor, setup the location of the diagram. Everything looked cool.
Saved the page and GIANT amount of white space appeared that had not been visible in the editor.
I find this a major issue simply because users' expectations for editing/rendered layout will be pretty high with a WYSWYG editor. 

I've seen a similar problem with sections.

BTW, I tried searching for a dup but nothing was immediately obvious.
fields.summary: Extra Spaces Added Above Included Gliffy Diagram WYSWYG Fail

fields.description:
When a line is selected within the 'code macro' using the steps bellow:

# Open Firefox, create a new page.
# Add Code-macro
# Type 
{noformat}
actor abc
actor def
abc -> def
{noformat}
(i) note: Don't use the mouse, use the keyboard to navigate.
## Arrow up
## Hold Shift + Ctrl, 2x Arrow Left
## Hold Shift but release Ctrl, 1x Arrow Left
## Hit Backspace

That action deletes all lines above.
fields.summary: Use of Backspace deletes more than the selected line
add instruction to User > Watches page

fields.description:
h3. Summary of Bug

When using Confluence 3.5.6 in Windows 7 x64 bit, if a thumbnail of an image is clicked, the image will not expand, instead, it will just keep loading.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# In a x64bit version of Windows 7, run Confluence 3.5.6
# Attach an image into the editor, and ensure thumbnail is set to 'on'. Save the page.
# Click on the image. 

h3. Findings

This bug seems to only affect the x64bit version of Windows 7, and only with Confluence 3.5.6. I have not tested the other 3.5 versions, but this bug does not affect Confluence 4.
fields.summary: Thumbnail does not expand when using Windows 7 x64bit

fields.description:
h3. Summary of Bug

When using Internet Explorer 8, there are problems when trying to add a page from templates. Not all of the templates can be chosen. More accurately, every 2nd template does not have the radio button, thus the user is unable to select it.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a global template (Importing the default global templates also works)
# In a space, select 'Create page from template'
# When selecting from the choice of templates, only certain templates can be chosen.
!IE8 page template.png|thumbnail!

h3. Findings

This seems to only affect Internet Explorer 8. Creating page from templates work fine in Firefox and Chrome.
fields.summary: When trying to create page from global templates in IE8, not all templates can be chosen (absence of the radio button)

fields.description:
The Confluence installer does not install Confluence to start automatically on system startup, even when requested.

On the same host, the JIRA 4.4.3 did successfully install JIRA to start automatically on system startup.

I've attached the installation log.  It shows that install_linux_service.sh is never run.
fields.summary: Installer doesn't install as service

fields.description:
h4. Summary of The Bug

When a page containing a tasklist macro is exported to PDF. The result would always show that the tasklist width is about 60% of the page even if configured with another value as describe on this screenshot

*Page Display*
Width configured = 15%
!page15%.png|thumbnail!

*PDF result*
!pdf.png|thumbnail!

Confluence does not thrown any stack trace into the logs

h4. How to reproduce

# Create a page and insert tasklist macro into it
# Configured the tasklist macro width as preferred
# Export the page into pdf
# The result would show that the width of the tasklist is ignored by PDF exporter [attachment|ta-TasklistTest-111111-1503-15.pdf]
fields.summary: PDF exporter doesn't honour configured tasklist width
Clean up/sync delegated LDAP users
Allow LDAP users to be assigned to groups or permissions prior to initial log in

fields.description:
1. Create a list like this:
* row 1
** row 1.1
** row 1.2
* row 2
** row 2.1
** row 2.2

2. Select all of 'row 2' and delete it

3. you'll end up with either something like this where row 2.1 has double-bullets
* row 1
** row 1.1
** row 1.2
** row 2.1
** row 2.2

or something like this:
* row 1
** row 1.1
** row 1.2
** 
** row 2.1
row 2.2

or something like this where you can't delete the empty row:
* row 1
** row 1.1
** row 1.2
* 
** row 2.1
** row 2.2
fields.summary: More weirdness with nested bullets

fields.description:
To reproduce:
1. create two bullet lists like

* list 1 item 1
* list 1 item 2
* list 1 item 3

* list 2 item 1
* list 2 item 2

2. copy the entirety of list 2
3. paste it between items 2 and 3

you'd expect to get:
* list 1 item 1
* list 1 item 2
* list 2 item 1
* list 2 item 2
* list 1 item 3

instead you get:
* list 1 item 1
* list 1 item 2
** list 2 item 1
** list 2 item 2
* list 1 item 3
fields.summary: Pasting bullets from one list to another should not leave them indented
Copying and pasting list items into an existing list

fields.description:
This is happening on EAC. See the attached video for a simple test case.

- blank page, add Panel > Section > Column
- in the column add a bulleted list, then use backspace to collapse the list.
fields.summary: Backspace in section macros duplicates all parent sections

fields.description:
To replicate;

1) create new page

2) leave page name blank

3) enter some body

4) press 'save'

5) warning message appears on top telling user to add a heading.

6) add title, press 'preview'

= error message still displayed on page.

Please also note there is no validation for this when the user selects 'preview' prior to selecting 'save'.
fields.summary: Error messages remain on preview page even when error is fixed.

fields.description:
Pressing enter on a page title section acts same way as pressing 'save'.

The ideal action would be to disable the enter action on the page layout title since it's only one line.

this is reproduced on all browsers.
fields.summary: pressing enter on a page title actions 'save' function.

fields.summary: OOME when converting large Word document to HTML
Round-tripping between RTE and Wiki Markup causes
noformat macro freezes the instance when editing a page
Macros inside of User Macros do not render after Confluence 4.0 upgrade

fields.description:
Pasting in code with indents (either with tabs or spaces) does not work - rendering the Code-Block Macro useless for displaying the code we want to show. This appears to be a more general problem with the editor as attempting to use the noformat macro results in the same stripping of white space.

This was also tagged here: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-22979 and discussed in the comments here: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Code+Block+Macro
fields.summary: {code} macro does not render indentation/tabs

fields.description:
Using XML backups to copy parts of a space from one wiki instance to another wiki instance, even though only certain pages are selected, the XML backup process is backing up the entire space and ignoring the selections. For example:

* The space "test" has 3 pages:
  - page 1
  - page 2
  - page 3

* If we select to perform a XML backup of the space and select just the page 1 to backup, when we restore this backup, the whole space will be restore (page 1, page 2, page 3) into the new one, and not just the page 1 that was the page that we selected to backup.

Reproduced with the versions 3.4.7, 3.4.8, 3.4.9 and 3.5.

And in the version 3.5.13 is fixed. (4.0 also is fixed).
fields.summary: XML backup doesn't restore only the selected pages but the all space content

fields.description: Regardless of daily backup is enabled or not, the *Daily XML Backup* in *View System Information* will always display *Enabled*.
fields.summary: Daily XML Backup In View System Information Display Wrong Value

fields.description:
Here are the following steps on how to reproduce this bug:
# Start up a Confluence 4.x server
# In any space, create a sample page
# Enter the following:
{noformat}
* My Bug [Enter] Your Bug [Enter] Sub-Bug [Tab]
{noformat}
# Then, hover your mouse cursor to the end of first line and click it
# Press *Delete* button (even multiple times) and it does not work
# If starting from Step 3 all over again but this time if you hover your mouse cursor to the end of second line and click it, the *Delete* button works as normal
|

This has been tested with Firefox 7.0.1, Firefox 8, IE 8.076, and Chrome 15.0.874.106. However, this problem only happens in *Firefox 7.0.1. and Firefox 8 only so far*.
fields.summary: Unable to delete line after bullet list indentation

fields.description:
Here are the steps on how to reproduce your bug:
# Start up a Confluence 4.x server
# In any space, create a sample page
# Type SHIFT+8 (Asterisk) + space + (any words/text)
# Press TAB button (indent)
# Delete all the content 
# Repeat again by typing SHIFT+8 (Asterisk) + space + (any words/text) 
# You will notice that the word/text will appear right below at the next line as the mouse cursor has already being misplaced
|

This has been tested with Firefox 7.0.1, Firefox 8, IE 8.076, and Chrome 15.0.874.106. However, this problem only happens in *Firefox 7.0.1. and Firefox 8 only so far*.
fields.summary: Mouse cursor is misplaced after bullet list indentation

fields.description:
Here are the following steps on how to reproduce this bug:
# Start up a Confluence 4.0.3 server
# In any space, create a sample page
# Type in any words/text (e.g: What)
# Highlight and copy it 
# Press Space Bar for about 10 - 15 times
# Paste the word/text, "What"
# Then, paste it once more somewhere between the line 
# Hit on *Backspace* button 
# The mouse cursor will jumped to the end of line (last "What" word) causing it to delete the last character of the line
|

This has been tested with Firefox 8, IE 8.076, and Chrome 15.0.874.106. However, this problem only happens in *Firefox 8* only so far.
fields.summary: Copy and paste a word somewhere in between the line makes the mouse cursor jumped to the end of line after hitting Backspace button

fields.description:
Here are the following steps on how to reproduce this bug:
# Start up a Confluence 4.x server
# In any space, create a sample page
# Enter a format of Headline 1 (CTRL+1) - example in Wiki markup: h1. Title 1
# Hit "Enter" button
# Insert SHIFT+8 (Asterisk) or "-" button and then press SPACE button
# It will now auto format it to *Bullet List*
# Move your mouse cursor to Headline 1 and click on it 
# Click back to "Bullet List" line
# You will now see that the mouse cursor appears at the end of the line
# Pressing on any alphabets or numbers will not have any effect except pressing the *Backspace* button
|

This has been tested with Firefox 8, IE 8.076, and Chrome 15.0.874.106. However, this problem only happens in *Firefox 8* only so far.
fields.summary: Mouse cursor jumped to the end of line after inserting the auto formatting of asterisk or dash button in Firefox 8

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23826].
  {panel}

Heading formats will not render if wiki-markup is preceeded by a space

i.e.
{noformat} h1. JoeyC's Excellent Adventure{noformat}

Keeping this as minor as this scenario is unlikely. That is, I can't think of a scenario where a user would want to put a space before using the heading

h5. Reproduced on
h6. Environment
(/) Stable
h6. Browsers
(/) IE8
(/) IE9
(/) FF8
(/) Chrome
fields.summary: Heading autoformatting will not render if preceded by a space

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23825].
  {panel}

*Steps to reproduce*
# Apply a heading format to text (either by shortcut or toolbar)
# Start a new line

*expected:* format returns to "Paragraph" on new line
*actual"* heading format persists

h5. Reproduced on
h6. Environment
(/) Stable
h6. Browsers
(x) IE8
(/) IE9
(x) FF8
(x) Chrome
fields.summary: Can't escape heading formatting by starting a new line on IE9

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce: 

# create a new page
# CMD + K to insert a link 
# click on the "Advanced" tab (if its not already selected)
# type "#foo" into the link text field
# tab twice to move the focus to the "Insert" button
# press enter
# nothing is inserted into the editor

It may be a bit difficult to reproduce.
fields.summary: Linkbrowser can insert "nothing" if the server takes too long to fill in the alias field
